event.descr:
This event is generated when the Hold function assumes the state holding-prm or holding-sec. The current state is: %parm[#2]%, where 1 indicates holding is not implemented, 2 indicates not holding, 3 indicates holding on primary and 4 indicates holding on secondary. The station ID is: %parm[#1]%.

fddimibSMTStationId%parm[#1]%

a3ComFddiSMTHoldState%parm[#2]% not-implemented(1) not-holding(2) holding-prm(3) holding-sec(4)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: FDDI SMT Hold Condition has been established.

event.descr:
This event is generated when the FDDI SMT Peer Wrap Flag is set. The current state is: %parm[#2]%, where 1 = isolated, 2 = local_a, 3 = local_b, 4 = local_ab, 5 = local_s, 6 = wrap_a, 7 = wrap_b, 8 = wrap_ab, 9 = wrap_s, 10 = c_wrap_a, 11 = c_wrap_b, 12 = c_wrap_s, 13 = thru.

fddimibSMTStationId%parm[#1]%

fddimibSMTPeerWrapFlag%parm[#3]% true(1) false(2)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: FDDI SMT Peer Wrap Condition Set.

event.descr:
This event occurs when a duplicate MAC address is found by the SMT or the upstream neighbor. True = 1 and False = 2. The value for the SMT is: fddimibMACDaFlag=%parm[#4]%, and the upstream neighbor is: fddimibMACDaFlag=%parm[#5]%.

fddimibSMTStationId%parm[#1]%

fddimibMACSMTAddress%parm[#2]%

fddimibMACUpstreamNbr%parm[#3]%

fddimibMACDaFlag%parm[#4]% true(1) false(2)

fddimibMACUnaDaFlag%parm[#5]% true(1) false(2)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: A duplicate MAC address has been found on a FDDI ring.

event.descr:

fddimibMACLostCts%parm[#5]%

fddimibMACFrameErrorRatio%parm[#6]%

event.descr: A chipHello trap is sent every minute by an agent with the hello trap enabled. The hello trap will discontinue being sent when either the agent receives an authenticate SNMP request, or after 255 minutes.

event.descr: A chipHardware trap indicates that a soft hardware failure has been detected. An example of a soft hardware failure is too many writes to non-volatile storage. This is an indication to get the unit serviced.

event.descr: A chipSoftware trap indicates that a soft software failure has been detected. This is an indication to get the unit serviced.

event.descr: A chipChange trap is used to indicate that a configuration change has occurred.

event.descr: A chipFatal trap is used to indicate that a fatal error has occurred. This is an indication to get the unit serviced.
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Fatal Error has occurred.

event.descr:
A chipPing trap is sent after the SNMP initiated PING command is completed. After the last echo request packet is sent, this trap is sent indicating the ping address (%parm[#1]%), the number of requests sent (%parm[#2])%, and the number of responses received (%parm[#3]%)at the time the trap was generated.

chipEchoAddr%parm[#1]%

chipEchoNumber%parm[#2]%

chipEchoResponseCounts%parm[#3]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: SNMP initiated PING command is complete.

event.descr: This trap indicates that a variable that is being thresholded as specified by an entry in olThreshTable has exceeded its threshold. Another chipAboveThreshold trap will not be sent until olThreshCurrentValue drops below olThreshValue and then again exceeds it. The following variables are in the varBind list: olThreshIndex (%parm[#1]%), olThreshDescription (%parm[#2]%), olThreshStatCategory (%parm[#3]%), olThreshStatType (%parm[#4]%), olThreshStatNetID (%parm[#5]%), olThreshStatSlotIndex (%parm[#6]%), olThreshStatPortIndex (%parm[#7]%), olThreshStatStationAddr (%parm[#8]%), olThreshObjectIdentifier (%parm[#9]%), olThreshInterval (%parm[#10]%), olThreshCondition (%parm[#11]%), olThreshCurrentValue (%parm[#12]%), olThreshValue (%parm[#13]%), olThreshActionData (%parm[#14]%), olThreshActionPriority (%parm[#15]%).
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: A threshold has been exceeded.

event.descr: A chipBelowThreshold trap indicates that a Counter or Gauge variable had exceeded its threshold but is now below its threshold.
event.logmsg: 3com Event: A gauge variable is now below threshold.

event.descr:
A chipModuleDown trap is sent only by ONcore agents. It indicates that management communication with the slot indicated by ocModSlotIndex has been broken.

This event usually occurs when a module has been physically removed from the concentrator, in which case the agent will follow this trap with a chipSlotDown trap. However, it is possible for this trap to be sent when the particular module fails but has not been removed from the slot. In that case, no chipSlotDown trap is sent.

ocModSlotIndex%parm[#1]%

ocModSubSlotIndex%parm[#2]%

ocModType%parm[#3]%

ocModDescr%parm[#4]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: ONcore agent has lost communication with manager.

event.descr:
A chipModuleUp trap is sent only by ONcore agents. It indicates that management communication with the slot indicated by ocModSlotIndex has been established.

This event usually occurs when a module has physically been inserted into the concentrator, in which case the agent will have already sent a chipSlotUp trap. This trap may also be sent when communications have been restored, even if the module was never physically removed; in such a case, no chipSlotUp trap will have been sent.

ocModSlotIndex%parm[#1]%

ocModSubSlotIndex%parm[#2]%

ocModType%parm[#3]%

ocModDescr%parm[#4]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: ONcore agent now communicating with manager.

event.descr:
This trap indicates a change in the security environment. The olNetOlSecTrapReason specifies the reason for the trap. Some traps may include additional information, depending upon the reason. This value is set to %parm[#1]%.

Which indicates: intrusion-attempt(2), net-secured(3), or net-unsecured(4).

olNetOlSecTrapReason%parm[#1]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Security environment change.

event.descr: The newRoot trap indicates that the sending agent has become the new root of the Spanning Tree; the trap is sent by a bridge soon after its election as the new root, e.g., upon expiration of the Topology Change Timer immediately subsequent to its election.
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Bridge had been elected as root of Spanning Tree.

event.descr: A topologyChange trap is sent by a bridge when any of its configured ports transitions from the Learning state to the Forwarding state, or from the Forwarding state to the Blocking state. The trap is not sent if a newRoot trap is sent for the same transition.
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Bridge Topology Change.

event.descr:

event.logmsg: 3Com Event: The repeater has changed status.

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a change occurs in the group structure of a repeater. This occurs only when a group is logically removed from or added to a repeater. The varBind list contains the identifier of the group that was removed or added.

deprRptrGroupIndex%parm[#1]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: A repeater has changed its group structure.

event.descr:
This trap is sent on completion of a repeater reset action.

event.logmsg: 3Com Event: A repeater has been reset.

event.descr: Generated at a regular interval to inform the manager this device is still operating and can be reached on the network.

event.logmsg: 3Com Event: A gauge has dropped below the recovery threshold.

event.descr:
When a system load is requested, a response is returned immediately and the load proceeds in the background.

The status is: %parm[#1]%, which means:

  • (1) file not found;
  • (2) access violation;
  • (4) illegal TFTP operation;
  • (5) unknown transfer ID;
  • (7) no such user;
  • (8) no response from the load server;
  • (9) the download could not be started because of a lack of resources;
  • (10) the length of a record differs from that implied by the value of the record length field;
  • (11) the record type is not recognised;
  • (12) record checksum error;
  • (13) the device type in the file is incorrect;
  • (14) the software image is not suitable for this version of the hardware;
  • (15) the first record in the file was not a file header;
  • (16) The byte count reported in the file trailer record differed from the number of bytes actually received;
  • (200) the load file contained a load address which was outside the valid range of memory;
  • (201) the load data was corrupted as it was transferred from the management agent to the subsidiary module;
  • (202) the management agent timed out while waiting for a response from the subsidiary module;
  • (203) the subsidiary module was unable to accept a command from the management agent;
  • (204) the subsidiary module was removed during the download;
  • (205) the download could not continue because of a lack of resources;
  • (255) the subsidiary module failed during the download.

When loading a new image into the device containing the agent itself, the agent first reads the beginning of the image file to test if it is accessible and contains a valid image. If there is anything wrong, this trap is generated, no download is performed and the device continues to run uninterrupted. If this check is successful the download proper is begun. Should that fail, it is simply retried continuously until either an attempt succeeds or the device is reset.

slLoadStatus%parm[#1]% fileNotFound(1) accessViolation(2) illegalOperation(4) unknownTransferID(5) noSuchUser(7) noResponse(8) noResource(9) recLenMismatch(10) invalidRecType(11) checksumError(12) wrongDevice(13) wrongHardwareVersion(14) noFileHeader(15) byteCountError(16) invalidProgAddress(17) eraseFailed(18) progFailed(19) loadPending(20) loadActive(21) success(22) stoppedByUser(23) fileNotWanted(24) statusUnknown(25) modInvalidAdress(200) modChecksumError(201) modTimeout(202) modBusy(203) modRemoved(204) modNoResource(205) modFailure(255)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: System Load Failed.

event.descr: When the end-station table moves from the noChange to modified state this trap is generated. The trap is sent once on this transition and not subsequently until the 'Database State' is changed back to 'noChange' by a manager.
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: End-station table has been modified.

event.descr: When the end-station table becomes full this trap is generated.
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: End-station Table has become full.

event.descr:
This trap is sent whenever a managed MAU enters the jabber state.

This trap indicates that the MAU for this port has entered or left the available state.

This trap is sent when the partition state of a port changes. The trap is accompanied by the new partition state of the port: %parm[#1]%.

event.descr:
This trap is sent when the port bandwidth used (%parm[#1]%) exceeds the defined threshold (%parm[#2]%). This threshold is by default 15%, although this may have been changed on a particular device.

gaugeThresholdLevel%parm[#2]%

gaugeSamplePeriod%parm[#3]%

event.descr:
This trap is sent when the errors per packet (%parm[#1]%) exceeds the the defined threshold (%parm[#2]%).

gaugeThresholdLevel%parm[#2]%

gaugeSamplePeriod%parm[#3]%

gaugeSamplesPerAverage%parm[#4]% nonAveraging(1) twoSamples(2) threeSamples(3) maxSamples(4)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Errors per packet has exceeded threshold on a given port.

event.descr:
This trap is generated when a change of state of one of the ports in a resilient pair does not result in a switch of active port. If such a switch were to occur the resResilienceSwitch would be generated. Generation of this trap is summarised in the following table:

 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 State        |                         Event
 Main    Backup  |Main Fail      |Main OK        |StandBy Fail   |Standby OK
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Active  OK      |  switch       |  -----        |  state        |  -----
 Active  Fail    |  state        |  -----        |  -----        |  state
 OK      Active  |  state        |  -----        |  switch       |  -----
 Fail    Active  |  -----        |  state        |  state        |  -----
 Fail    Fail    |  -----        |  switch       |  -----        |  state
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

In this table '-----' indicates no trap is sent. 'switch' indicates the resResilienceSwitch trap is sent and 'state' indicates resStateChange is sent.

NOTE: The agent in the MSH does not suppress any traps that caused the state change. For example if the active link is lost then both a 'loss-of-link' trap AND a resilienceSwitch trap are generated.

resMainState%parm[#1]% failed(1) ok(2) ok-and-active(3)

resStandbyState%parm[#2]% failed(1) ok(2) ok-and-active(3)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Resilient pair active port change.

event.descr:
This trap is generated when a change of state of one of the ports in a resilient pair does not result in a switch of active port. If such a switch were to occur the resResilienceSwitch would be generated. Generation of this trap is summarised in the following table: 

 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 State        |                         Event
 Main    Backup  |Main Fail      |Main OK        |StandBy Fail   |Standby OK
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Active  OK      |  switch       |  -----        |  state        |  -----
 Active  Fail    |  state        |  -----        |  -----        |  state
 OK      Active  |  state        |  -----        |  switch       |  -----
 Fail    Active  |  -----        |  state        |  state        |  -----
 Fail    Fail    |  -----        |  switch       |  -----        |  state
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

In this table '-----' indicates no trap is sent. 'switch' indicates the resResilienceSwitch trap is sent and 'state' indicates resStateChange is sent.

NOTE: The agent in the MSH does not suppress any traps that caused the state change. For example if the active link is lost then both a 'loss-of-link' trap AND a resilienceSwitch trap are generated.

resMainState%parm[#1]% failed(1) ok(2) ok-and-active(3)

resStandbyState%parm[#2]% failed(1) ok(2) ok-and-active(3)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Resilient pair state has changed.

pollTargetType%parm[#3]% other(1) file-server(2)

event.descr: The filtering database within the bridge has become overloaded or full.

event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Access group violation attempt detected.

event.descr:
This trap indicates that either the Filtering databse or the permanent database has become full. If the database occupancy exceeds 90% this trap will be sent also. The variable bindings enable the trap to be identified as refering to the filtering or permanet database, and to differentiate between 90% or 100% full.

brDatabaseType%parm[#1]% filtering(1) permanent(2)

brDatabaseLevel%parm[#2]% ninetyPercent(90) oneHundredPercent(100)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Bridge database is full.

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a new entity is detected in the chassis. The entity is identified both by its location in the chassis and it's type information. The display string is included to make event descriptions more understandable. The phyServiceId indicates to which service the new entity belongs or implements. If the entity belongs to more than one service then this parameter indicates one of the services.

phyServiceType%parm[#1]% dumb8023Repeater(1) ieee8023Repeater(2) ieee8025MauModule(3) ieee8025Ringbuilder(4) fddiConcentrator(5) managementModule(6) standardBackplane(12) extendedBackplane(13) displayPanel(14) fan(17) powerSupply(18) standardBridge(19) bridgePerPort(20) terminalServer(21) remoteBridge(22) fddiMIC(23) notAllocated(24) fddiLinkSwitch(25)

phyEntityType%parm[#2]%

phyServiceId%parm[#3]%

phyNumberOfPorts%parm[#4]%

phyEntityName%parm[#5]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: A new entity is present in the chassis.

event.descr:
This trap is sent when an entity is removed. The qualifier information on the variables identify the location of the entity that has been removed while the entity name is the textual description of the card that was removed.

phyServiceId%parm[#1]%

phyEntityName%parm[#2]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: An entity has been removed from the chassis.

event.descr:
This trap is sent when the facility table is changed. This trap is only send when the change is made as the result of a local management request. The trap includes information about the type of the connection changed and the new connection value.

phyServiceId%parm[#1]%

fcType%parm[#2]% ieee8023(1) ieee8025(2) fddi(3) ieee8025rb(4) ieee8023v3(5) atm(6) smds(7)

fcConnection%parm[#3]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: The facility table has changed.

event.descr:
This trap is sent when a card is added to a service. This trap is always sent, regardless of how the card addition occurred. There are two situations in which a card is added to a service. The first is where a new card is inserted and is attached to a service. The second is where an existing card is removed from one service and added to another.

Note that the transmission of this trap may imply the creation of a new service.

phyServiceId%parm[#1]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: A card has been added to a service.

event.descr:
This trap is sent when an entity is removed from a service. This trap is always sent, regardless of how the card removal occurred. There are two situations in which a card is removed from a service. The first is where a card is removed from the chassis. The second is where an existing card is removed from one service and added to another.

The service id in the variables list indicates the service to which to card did belong.

Note that the transmission of this trap may imply that the service to which it belongs no longer exists. This is the case where the card was the only current member of the service.

phyServiceId%parm[#1]%
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: An entity has been removed from service.

event.descr:
A physical entity in the rack has changed state. This can be the result of a failure or recovery. The variables accompanying this trap identify the entity which has changed state.

phyServiceId%parm[#1]%

phyEntityState%parm[#2]% unknown(1) initialising(2) operational(3) failure(4)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: A physical entity has changed state.

event.descr: The combination of the power requirements of all the entities in the chassis has been calculated to exceed the power capacity of the power supplies present in the chassis.
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Power supply exceeded capacity.

event.descr:

event.descr:

event.descr:
This trap indicates either that the main and backup rings have wrapped, or that the wrap condition has been removed. The var-bind indicates the new state.

a3ComRingWrapState%parm[#1]% ringNotWrapped(1) ringWrapped(2) notAvailable(3)
event.logmsg: 3Com Event: Either the main or backup rings have wrapped.
